intro: Arisaema costatum, commonly known as the Chinese cobra lily, is a flowering plant native to China. It is characterized by its distinctive, hooded spathaceous inflorescence and unique, palmate leaves. The plant belongs to the Araceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important species. Arisaema costatum typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Its foliage and floral structure make it a popular choice for botanical gardens and horticultural collections.
